column1: gone first ball! What a ripper! Pitches on off stump. Seams away late. Squares up the batsman. Gets extra bounce for good measure. Rahul, caught in the crease, forced to deal with a brutish delivery is caught behind. Sri Lanka have made their presence felt

beautiful bowling. In conditions like these, you have to pitch the ball in line with the stumps. And Lakmal does that, pitching it up to bring the batsman forward. Pujara, watching it carefully, and leaves it outside off
cuts Pujara in half! The indipper, and since it's fullish, and it moves only after pitching Pujara has no clue which way it will move. But the time it darts back in, he is nowhere
extra bounce, and Pujara, defending off the back foot, with soft hands, nearly plays on
back of a length and outside off, Pujara lets it go
teaser outside off, asking for Pujara to cover drive, but he's a little too smart for that
angled into the body from around the wicket, Dhawan waits for it so he can nudge it off his hips towards square leg
short ball, outside off, easy sighter for Pujara to avoid. Immediately Herath at mid-on goes over to talk to the bowler
wide outside off this time and Pujara enjoys leaving one more freebie
back of a length and outside off, Pujara is more than happy to not be tested like this
corrects his line, and the shortish delivery on middle at only 77 mph, is blunted well enough
full and wide, Pujara's work is done simply watching the ball wander through to the wickekeeper
tries to flick a full delivery on the pads, doesn't make contact with the bat, but will be happy to pinch the leg bye
good batting, meeting the ball late, getting on top of the bounce and guiding it to the gully fielder. A tough short this time from Lakmal, although the line is perfectly on off stump
back of a length and outside off - and it's that length that gives Pujara the early warning that he can leave
a little fuller, but Pujara is still able to cover it off the back foot. The line is a shade outside off
pitches it up outside off and makes it seam away, Pujara lets it go again
good work, targeting the stumps and making Pujara play. He does so waiting until the ball is right under his eyes. Good block

right then, he finds his line to the left-hander. Going around the wicket, he pitches it full and Dhawan very nearly falls for the angle. Goes for a flick, and only at the last moment does he square himself up and present a straighter face
clips a shortish delivery off his hips to deep square leg
good leave. Dhawan moves across on off stump and then leaves the back of a length delivery that is outside his eyeline
half an appeal for lbw, with Dhawan unsure if he wants to move forward or back. The inbetween length that Gamage accessed was with a delivery that is sliding down leg
cuts back in from outside off at 130 kph, Dhawan, in his effort to play late, is a touch too slow to make proper contact. Inside edge onto pad
laces it to the point boundary. That's Dhawan's shot. Anything short and wide outside off, he flays it away, and with this field, with five men behind him, poor bowling becomes easy pickings
beaten! Pujara is finally drawn into poking at one he shouldn't. But it's not his fault. Lakmal suckers him into the mistake with a pitched up delivery on off stump that both swings and seams away
the length is right - full and asking for the drive - but the line goes a touch awry. Too wide for Pujara to show interest
back of a length and outside off, Pujara picks up the line early and ignores it like a tweet older than 10 minutes
another chance to show off his leave as Lakmal plies outside off with a short delivery
shoves his bat skyward so that the away seamer, pitching on fourth stump looks harmless. Excellent judgment from Pujara

beautiful batting. Keeps on the back foot, waits for the ball to do its bit and then with the softest hands bunts it to the right of his feet. Lakmal needs to be fuller, he can be so dangerous when he's fuller
now he goes over the wicket but the line is still on leg stump. Dhawan gets another easy single off the first ball of the over to square leg

pushes at a delivery that is just short of a good length, and Pujara, looking not perfectly in control, finds the third man boundary. His feet are on leg stump. His bat is searching for the ball, which nips in off the deck rather late
extra bounce! Hits the deck outside off, and gets it to dart in off the seam. Pujara leaves well
fuller delivery outside off, Pujara gives it the respect he needs to so he can bully the bad balls later
covers the shortish delivery, coming in off the pitch, in front of off stump
fuller delivery on fourth stump, Pujara comes forward to block
swing, but it starts on leg stump and moves further down. Dhawan attempts the flick and can't reach the ball

inside edge, fatal! That's a rash shot from Dhawan, going for the on-the-up drive on a pitch doing a heck of a lot. Short front foot stride, but it doesn't go across towards the ball, instead it comes down the line so he has room for the shot and inadvertently creates the gap for Lakmal to burst through
sooooooo close! Kohli is brought forward by a delivery that pitches on off stump and sashays past the outside edge. You sexy thing you.
leaves a fuller delivery outside off - those are the ones he cover drives in limited-overs pitches
good batting as he picks up the line of a shortish delivery to be outside off and then forgets about its very existence
short delivery on middle, defends as close to his body as he could. Four successive maidens from Lakmal, and he's got two wickets as well
fuller delivery on off stump, actually, it curls in to get there. Pujara defends

beaten outside the off stump. And Pujara goes down to inspect the pitch that seems so set against him. Gamage is finally getting into some rhythm, getting the ball to move both ways. Here, he makes it hold its line and the batsman, playing the angle, is done
that's how you drive a ball on this pitch. wait for the half-volley and don't hit it too hard that that a bat-pad gap is created. Mid-off can't get there

unplayable! Fullish delivery, showing no sign that it would hit the pitch and move in at the batsman. Pujara is brought forward, plays inside the line and misses. Seems like the plan Australia adopted in Pune against India's spinners: don't mind being beaten by the awayswinger, but I want to be ready for the one that comes in at the stumps
shortish and outside off, no need to spend any energy on those
too short and Pujara is only too happy to keep playing these kinds of deliveries. He's camping on the back foot, desperate to have that little extra time to deal with the movement on offer.
good length ball outside off, lets it go
falls short of midwicket. This pitch is not yet hard, and as a result, there is no pace on it. Kohli gets a ball on leg stump, his bread and butter, but he doesn't time the flick
good length, slight shape away from off stump. Defended solidly with soft hands
back of a length, shaping away and climbing in the corridor. Left alone
beats the outside edge. This zips away like a leg-break from back of a length, a watchful poke from Kohli. He's nowhere near
oh so good. Late swing away from off stump, good length. Very anxiously defended on the front foot. Loose hands
overpitched, marginally swinging in from outside off. There for the drive, but he won't take it
short and wide outside off this time, for the cut. Once again, bait not taken. Watches it float by
back of a length just outside off, thinks of punching off the back foot and withdraws at the last moment. It's not the quickest of pitches, he had time to adjust
another one that deviates a long way off the pitch. India won't mind this. It pitches in the corridor, forces him on the back foot and beats him by a long way
angles this in at off stump. Back of a length, spitting up a touch as he looks to defend on the front leg. Hits the bat hard and deflects onto his toe
full and swinging in from outside off, big stride to cover the off stump as he lets this go

he looks plumb in front! Nigel Llong has given it. Kohli reviews. Superb bowling from Lakmal. It's the same nagging off stump line, but this one comes into Kohli who's playing for an off stump line...review shows it is umpire's call. He's gone! Lakmal has been sensational today. Kohli, even if that had swung away like he expected it to, would have been playing a very meek,anxious shot. A poke, really. He might have reviewed that for line, but it's clipping leg. India won't lose the review, but they've lost their captain
good length, bends away late. Defended with a half-stride and hard hands
good length at middle stump, solidly behind this as he defends down the pitch
niiiiiiiice. Good length, in the corridor and lifting up dangerously. Rahane does his part well, left alone

big, big appeal! But it's turned down. Oh this looks so close. Another one that comes back in off the pitch. Not too different from the Kohli one, but this has done a little too much and is probably going down
sixth maiden in a row for Lakmal. He's been that good. Back of a length ball, cutting in from outside off. Nicely covered off stump as this is allowed to fly through to Dickwella
short and wide outside off stump. He would have gone for a lot more runs than this on another day. Left alone for now
short of a length, wide outside off stump. Left alone
back of a length, slight shape in. Left alone
bouncer, dug in too short. He ducks it comfortably

oh dear! Like a glitch in a video game, this tickles past off stump. Outrageous. Swings back in a looong way, full and at off stump. An inch fuller and it would be a yorker. Pujara is playing for that. Rapidly bringing the bat down. And then...and then, it cuts away. And misses off stump. He couldn't do that again
good length, wiggling about before it lands and then straight through to the keeper outside off. Left alone
good length, nice swerve away after starting at off. Rahane wants to press on the front foot and feel for this, but he resists. Let's it go
back of a length, swinging away from outside off. Left alone
the perfect line. Starts just outside off, shapes away from the corridor. Left alone on the back foot
back of a length outside off, a bit of climb this time, not a lot of movement. Left alone
back of a length outside off, left alone as it shapes away

nearly. Nearly gives it away, Rahane. This one is bowled a tad wide of the crease and slants in at the corridor on a good length. He's stuck in his stride and fishing away from the body for the angle. Realises late that it was wide enough to leave. It's a whole lot of nothing in the end. Narrowly misses the outside edge
good length outside off stump, left alone. No movement
fuller outside off, hangs and moves away slowly. Dead-batted down the pitch on the front foot
124kph, good length, aimed for the top of off. Gets some lift off the pitch. Watchfully defended off the high part of the bat
shot. Goes really full this time, and floated at off stump. No need for a big stride - puts in a small step and drives hard enough to beat mid-off who got a hand on it
122 kph, back of a length outside off. Left alone
full outside off stump again, nice and easy. No movement. Thumped past the bowler with no fuss. Well away from the fielder at mid-off too this time
good length, swinging away from outside off. Covers the off stump and lets it go
very anxious as he presses forward against this length ball in the corridor. It nips in and takes the inside edge, before getting lodged behind the flap of his right pad
good length, just outside off. Straightens after angling in. Let's it pass
more assured in his leaving. This one bends away from a length outside off

runs. Actual runs off the bat against Lakmal. Still no control from the batsman. He goes wide of the crease, angles it in at off stump and swings it away. No feet from Rahane as he jabs well in front of his body. It's a thick edge that runs past the second gully
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
overpitched outside off stump, no movement. Tapped to short cover
length outside off stump, zips off the surface. But too wide for him to play at it
124kph, back of a length outside off, punched to cover off the back foot
good length, slanted in at middle stump. Tucked to fine leg off the inside half of the bat. His first single of the game
good length, just outside off. Forward to defend with soft hands
good length outside off, angled inwards. Rahane is drawn to it, but he gets his hands out of the way at the last moment and lets it fly
good length, swinging away from the corridor. Covers the off stump and lets it go
back of a length at off stump, defended into the floor off the back foot. Right under his eyes
back of a length, nips in to the corridor. Bunts it into the leg side off the back foot

well bowled. This is the Rahul Lite. Starts middle-and-off, back of a length. Swings away towards first slip and draws the edge - but it's a thick one, with the weight moving backwards and soft hands from Pujara. Into the gully region
length ball, slanted down leg side. Can't get bat on the flick
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot, down the pitch
good length, loops in at leg stump. Tapped to wide mid-on

he's got him! It was coming. Rahane has been trying hard to get some bat on it. And what better way to feed that temptation than a 125kph floater outside off? Length, no movement in the air and a slight natural variation off the pitch that's enough to beat his attempted cover drive on the up, wide outside off. Nowhere near the pitch and a thin edge behind
good length outside off, nips in from outside off. Stretches forward and plays inside the line. Beaten on the outside edge. It dies on the keeper and knocks him on the forearm
back of a length, wide outside off. No shot offered
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
full toss, floated outside off. Half-stride. Punch. Four through cover point
on he goes. Swinging away from a length, just outside off. Left alone
back of a length at leg stump, tucked off the thigh to fine leg. Lakmal indicates he was trying to swing that away. It didn't
full at off stump. No feet as he looks to lean in. Bat turns in his hand as he pushes it towards mid-off
good length, swinging from off stump. Defended into the covers, soft hands
back of a length at off stump, opens the face and defends towards point off the back foot
124kph, good length and slanted in at off stump. Defended on the front foot

overpitched outside off. Leans into the drive and goes through it a bit early. It's a damp pitch, not really skidding on. As a result he gets this to cover's right and past the bowler, instead of through the covers
back of a length, nips in and strikes him on the thigh guard as he looks to shovel it off the back foot
good length in the corridor, defended on the front foot
good length, wide outside off. Left alone
full outside off stump, looks to pummel this through the covers. But once again, it comes on slowly. Dribbles towards mid-off
good length, angled in at off stump and slight late movement away. Solidly defended on the front foot
good length outside off stump, shapes away. Left alone
back of a length, swinging away from outside off. Leaves it alone
unplayable. It's that template again. Wide of the crease, angle it in at off, shape it away. Ashwin is squared up and beaten on the outside edge
good length at middle stump, defended pitch side
good length, angled in at leg stump. Defended towards midwicket
slash and miss. It's the first slash I remember since the Dhawan wicket. This is short and wide. Ashwin goes after it and can't get bat on it
back of a length at middle stump, drops it into the leg side off the back foot and they beat the bowler to steal a single
good length at off stump, defended from the crease
full outside off, pushed to mid-off on the front foot
oh dear. Angles in at middle stump, Ashwin ready to poke it into the leg side and it cuts to fly over off stump. No bat.
length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket
back of a length at off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length, wide outside off. It cuts back in but it's still wide. Left alone
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length, no movement. Still too wide to get Pujara to play
just gets bat as this inswinger tails towards middle stump. Watches it very late and flicks the wrists at the last moment to get it down to fine leg
good length, wide outside off. Left alone
back of a length outside off, plays inside the line. Might not be a bad strategy actually. This deviates a long way away, past the outside edge
good length outside off, covers the off stump, left alone
overpitched outside off, handsome drive on the front foot, straight to cover on the bounce
good length at off stump, defended into the covers on the front foot
lovely. Nips it away from off stump after drawing him forward. Beaten on the outside edge
full and down leg side. It starts on middle and keeps swinging down, even after it passes the keeper's dive
inswinger at off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length outside off stump, no movement. Left alone

he's struck on his right thumb as this bouncer tails in at his throat. Fending away as this climbs awkwardly. It drops down and is headed for off stump but he has the awareness to kick it away before ripping his glove off and calling for medical assistance
short and wide outside off, left alone
full and wide outside off, no feet as he looks to drive through the covers. Poor shot
good length, wide outside off, stretches forward and lets this go
inswinger, good length and dipping in at middle stump. Tapped on the up to mid-on, with some gap between bat and pad

sweeeet. It's his kind of batting. He's always ready for the loose ball, ready to reward himself. Overpitched outside off and he leans in, throwing all his weight into it as he drives it between mid-off and cover
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length outside off, nips off the pitch, left alone
back of a length, nipping in from outside off. Squeezes it off the back foot, very late, to square leg's right
caught by surprise by the bouncer again. Not a convincing leave as this bouncer dips in at him

slices straight to backward point. Very ordinary from Ashwin. It's a length ball outside off.It doesn't nip away this time to beat the outside edge. Climbs towards the blade, which is open. On the rise, no feet, no transfer of weight forward. Reaching out in the end and it's straight to Karunaratne
back of a length outside off, left alone
short and just outside off, drops his wrists and lets it go
short ball at off stump, comfortably ducks under it
back of a length just outside off, watches it go
overpitched outside off, swinging away late, but he's to the pitch of this and taps it between wide mid-off and bowler
good length outside off stump, left alone
overpitched outside off, stretches forward and yorks himself as he looks to jab it square on the off side
full outside off stump, inside edges onto toe as he looks to drive
good length, slanting in at leg stump. Strikes him on the thigh guard as he prods at it anxiously with no feet
good length at off stump, shuffles and turns this into the midwicket region
full and just outside off, tapped back down the pitch off the front foot
full outside off, big front foot stride to cover the off stump and an animated withdrawal of the bat to let it go
back of a length, just outside off. Left alone
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
full and swinging in at off stump. Comes in very late, but handled nicely in the end. Squeezed through midwicket
full and wide outside off stump, too wide to play. So he doesn't
back of a length just outside off, jumps into his mid-riff and strikes him on the inner thigh as he looks to get the bottom hand off to defend
back of a length outside off, shuffles to cover off, left alone
...but he is an opening batsman primarily. Short and wide outside off, he latches onto it. Off the back foot. Punched to the extra cover fence
short and wide again. This one hurries him. Under-cuts it to cover's left
back of a length, swinging away from the corridor. The way he looks to defend this on the back foot - surprised, leaping - you'd think it was 150. It wasn't. Beaten on the outside edge
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
length at off stump, defended on the back foot
back of a length outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
full and swinging in at the corridor. Punched back at the bowler, along the pitch
back of a length at middle stump, poked wide of mid-on off the back foot
yorker just outside off. Looks to dab it through the slip cordon as he gets down to keep it out
bouncer in the corridor, ducks and lets it go
short ball in the corridor. Leaps to cover the bounce and drops it into the off side
poor shot. Length ball outside off, climbing away from a length. Chases it with his hands and is beaten on the outside edge
short ball at middle stump. I'll take the breather, says Pujara. Quickly on the back foot as he dismisses this with a slash. No one in the square leg region
full ball outside off, left alone
back of a length just outside off, pushed off the back foot to mid-off's left.  'Wait wait wait yes wait yes yes'...and they make it.
shot. Short ball wide outside off. Waits for it to arrive and chops it through point
back of a length, in at the pads. Glanced to fine leg
back of a length at the pads again, tickled more subtly this time, to fine leg's right. Forces a slide out of him too
short and wide outside off. Won't chase it. Left alone
overpitched on off stump, driven straight to mid-off
back of a length outside off, pokes away from the body with no feet. Gets an inside edge that rolls pitchside on the leg side
short ball outside off, left alone
full outside off stump, can't get the drive past the bowler who sticks out a left hand
good length, wobbles in the air and nips back off the pitch. In at middle stump. Pujara stretches forward and nudges this through square leg
good length, just outside off. Skids straight on. Defended comfortably on the front foot
tossed up outside off, steps out and mistimes a drive to short extra
length at off stump, slight bounce as he goes forward. Dead-bats it to short leg
good length at middle stump, defended down the pitch
full and fired down leg side. Gets down quickly and paddles it fine to bring up his 16th fifty
good length, floating in towards leg stump. Steps out and looks to flick. Sounds like he got an inside edge. This pings off the pad into the off side. Dickwella appeals and it is turned down
back of a length, wide outside off. Left alone
back of a length in the corridor, swings away late. He watches it closely and lets it go
good length, shaping away from off stump, left alone
oh well bowled. Good length, starting at middle and off and hooping away. Not enough time to move the feet, but Saha plays this right under his eyes with soft hands
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length, swinging away from the corridor. Big stride to cover the off stump as he lets it go
full outside off stump. Too far for Pujara to chase. Let's it sail to Dickwella who collects in front of this chest
good length, outside off stump. Left alone
back of a length, just outside off stump. Climbing off the pitch. Left alone
full and in at off stump. Solidly defended on the front foot
overpitched just outside off stump. Hard hands on the attempted cover drive. And a turning bat. Can't squeeze this past extra cover
back of a length outside off, left alone

just gets bat to keep this one out. It was heading for his pad - and his pad was in front of middle stump. Locked himself slightly by planting it across, but manages to watch it closely and nudge it into the leg side
bouncer dug in too short, comfortably sways away from it
good length at off stump, the front foot is planted across again. Very close to pad as he defends this
back of a length outside off stump, left alone
back of a length outside off, left alone
beauty. Angles into the corridor at a length, catches him halfway with the front foot and get it to lift past the outside edge
full outside off. He defends on the front foot, but it looks like that was an afterthought. It was there for the drive

breaches the defence! Superb ball from Gamage. The first big indipper of the match, and Pujara completely beaten. Unlike the last ball, he goes at this a little harder and this sneaks through. He had covered the line on the front foot, but it zips between bat and pad and rattles off stump
full and angled outside off. Left alone
full and just outside off. Tapped back down the pitch to the bowler
good length outside off, angling in to the left-hander. Defended on the front foot
good length outside off, nips away off the seam. Left alone
good length at off stump, defended into the covers from the crease
shot. Full and just outside off. Saha confident with the stride and not looking to go hard. Pokes it through the covers
good length in the corridor, left alone
oooh if this hadn't moved away, it would have lifted straight into Saha's mid-riff. He has to contort himself a little after shuffling to let it go. Outside off, off a length
good length outside off, covers the off stump and lets it go
well bowled. Good length ball, angled in at middle stump. Nudged to midwicket. That front leg looks like it'll get him in trouble against the ones aimed at his stumps
good length and in at off stump. Nudges it through extra cover with soft hands and gets off the mark
crunched. Classy from Saha. A long way outside his crease and that allows him to get to the pitch of this half-volley outside off. Gets his hands through it and beats point
length at off stump, tapped on the up to mid-off
short ball, climbs away from the corridor. Drops his wrists and lets it go
full at leg stump, not quite to the pitch as he flicks. It's aerial and goes between non-striker and wide mid-on. He was looking to go midwicket

raps him on the pad as he looks to nudge it off the back foot. Given not out. It rolls through the cordon for leg byes...and Chandimal reviews. Saha is a long way forward. This nipped in from off stump from back of a length....and it's going over. Wickets, missing. Hence, Sri Lanka lose the review.
good length outside off, big stride forward to defend into the off side
good length and just outside off, left alone
back of a length, slight movement off the pitch in the corridor. Defended off the back foot
back of a length outside off, walks across his stumps to cover it and lets it go
good length, wide outside off. Walks at this, then lets it go
back of a length outside off, steps out again, lets it go
back of a length and shaping away from off stump, no feet, stabs it to point
no stab this time. A full blooded slash. Short ball outside off, frees the arms and sends it to the cover fence
well played. A controlled punch, much straighter this time. Back of a length, wide outside off. Gets on his toes to punch this wide of mid-off
good length outside off, nips back in and takes the inside half of the bat as he stretches forward to defend
short and angled across off stump. Slashes at it again and it's aerial. Down to deep point...who might have caught that if he was inside
back of a length in the corridor, zips away a long distance as he looks to defend off the back foot

short and wide outside off. A subdued cut shot straight to point...who lunges forward awkwardly and misfields. It rolls slowly towards the boundary and he has to give chase. Slides at the boundary to try and flick it back in...and can't manage it
back of a length, in at the corridor. Defended to gully off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
swings it back in from outside off, but it's a tad wide. Jadeja was leaving this length ball on angle and it bent back in
back of a length just outside off. Unsure which way it's going this time. Pokes it to gully with no feet
back of a length floater at off stump. Tapped to extra cover off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
length at leg stump. Saha contemplates stepping out and makes the right decision to stay in to defend
full at off stump, poked to extra cover
short and skids through outside off. Well picked from Saha. Waits for it and times the late cut nicely to get it wide of slip
length ball, pushed down leg side. Past the attempted leg glance
back of a length outside off, hangs back and taps it past point
back of a length at leg stump. Can't get bat as he looks to flick. Deflects through square leg off his thigh guard
back of a length outside off. Left alone
good length outside off. Lunges forward to defend. Watches it climbs and offers soft hands to control the thick outside edge. And for his effort, gets a boundary as this squeezes past gully
good length and in the corridor. Walks into the forward push
back of a length at leg stump, walks down, nudges it off the thigh guard into the leg side. Was looking to nudge it off the bat, of course
back of a length into the pads, poked to deep backward square off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, defended to short leg off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
slapped over long-on. Too easy for Jaedja. Length ball at off stump, short stride forward, clean swing of the bat
full at leg stump, tapped into the leg side
back of a length at middle stump, can't get the back foot punch past the bowler
full and floated well down leg side. Dickwella leaps to his left to stop potential damage
back of a length at middle stump, poked into the midwicket region
overpitched outside off, driven to point with an open face
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
good length outside off, big stride forward. It climbs on him, but it's 117kph. Adjusts comfortably to dab it to gully
good length outside off, steps out, lets it go
short and wide, sliding through quickly and above the outside edge as he looks to cut
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length, drifted in at off stump. Defended on the front foot
back of a length at off stump, pushed back down the pitch off the back foot
arm ball, length outside off. Defended off the inside half
length outside off, skids back in late. Just manages to block it from his front pad off the inside half of the bat
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the outside half of the bat on the back foot
back of a length outside off, left alone
good length wide outside off, left alone
good length outside off, swings away from off stump. Big stride forward to defend to point
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot. This came back in. He was a long, long way down the pitch though
full outside off stump, driven to extra cover
short ball outside off, cut to extra cover
good length at off stump, nicely forward to defend into the off side

missed stumping. Straightforward chance. Full ball outside off, steps out, misses. It's just outside off. Dickwella looks surprised as it comes at him. And then, the inevitable grab when you pick it late. Saha was playing for the turn
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length at off, defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, swept to square leg
back of a length, angled across off stump. Left alone
good length at off stump, defended to cover off the front foot
length outside off stump, left alone
back of a length outside off, tapped to extra cover on the up
good length at off stump, lunges forward and runs it to deep point
full outside off and Saha is balanced this time. Lets it come on, drives comfortably through the covers
good length at off stump, defended down the pitch

skids back in and it's a bat-pad situation. Right in front of middle stump as he looks to defend. Given not out by Wilson. Sri Lanka review. Early indication is that it is pad first...yep. Pad first. Ball tracking will decide this...it's taking a while to come. The ball pitched outside off and came in with the arm. Remember, he's bowling around the wicket to Jadeja. It didn't deviate a long way. Pitching outside off, hitting in line, and it is hitting the wickets. Halfway up leg stump. The decision will be overturned. The review works for Sri Lanka and Jadeja is gone. Mentioned earlier how Perera skids it off the surface and that's what has happened. Caught Jadeja halfway into his stride across. He was threatening the inside edge last over and he's beaten it this time.
back of a length outside off, skids straight on. Poked into the off side off the outside half. On the back foot
good length outside off, big stride forward to defend into the off side

taken at first slip as he attempts to play the paddle sweep. Given out and he's reviewed straightaway. He says it's forearm. Looked and sounded like a top edge. But early looks at the replay show it's forearm...but that is before Ultra Edge comes into the picture. There's a spike. It's bat, says the third umpire. He's looking to see if the catch was taken cleanly. No doubt there, it's a reverse cup from Mathews at chest height. The decision will stand. India will lose that review. It wasn't a great shot to be honest. Not long after surviving that stumping
length ball outside off, skids past the outside edge as he looks to defend. Dickwella doesn't collect again. Looks like he has a nagging right thumb
gets the front leg out of the way and slashes it over cover. No control of the shot. Skews it off the bottom of the bat
back of a length at off stump, defended down the pitch
legcutter. Good length at off stump, cuts away and takes the outside edge as he looks to defened. And the crowd roars as this beats second slip's dive
back of a length outside off, punched past cover off the back foot
length at middle stump. Defended into the leg side
short ball in the channel, sways away to let it go
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
short ball, skids through fast and beats the outside edge as he looks to cut
back of a length at off stump, punched to extra cover off the back foot
good length at off stump, poked to cover off the front foot
length outside off, driven to point's right on the up
good length outside off, pushed to cover off the outside half of the bat
angled a full ball in at leg stump, Shami goes for the slog sweep and is beaten. It slides past leg stump. And Dickwella can't hold on
full at off stump, makes room and drives to extra cover
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
full at leg stump, pushed to long-on
back of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
full outside off, driven to deep point with fluid arms
good length outside off, stabs at it with no feet. Beaten on the outside edge
tossed up outside off, driven on the up to long-off
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, punched to deep point's left
lands in between midwicket and deep midwicket as he miscues an attempted slog. Length ball at middle stump, hit well enough to clear the fielder inside, poorly enough to tempt the fielder outside
nurdles a full delivery angled into him to deep square leg. Either he spots the line early or was merrily walking across off stump just for fun

can't stop him getting wickets. A rip-snorter of a delivery, pitching on a good length, holding its line, forcing Bhuvi to play, catching the edge and going through to the keeper. Well-deserved fourth for Lakmal, and he has a chance of adding one more to the bag
blocks a shortish delivery outside off, and with no one at cover, he gets off the mark
clears the front leg and goes for a monster hit over midwicket. The ball laughs all the way through to the keeper's gloves. Still some seam movement off the pitch for Lakmal
looks for his fifth with a yorker, but Shami is able to dig it out
hoicks a length ball outside off to a deepish mid-on. Herath nails the stumps, which offers an overthrow
fullish and outside off, Umesh squirts it through point to raise the 150.
pulls a short ball outside off to deep midwicket. Good on Shami that, picks up the length so very early

outside edge sails over first slip. Kolkata roar for the local boy! Shami's taken a couple of five-fors for Bengal in the Ranji Trophy, and he's giving himself some cushion to take another, for India, at Eden
top edge to the boundary right behind him. Attempted bouncer from Gamage, and Shami, clearing the front leg, slogs it much to the delight of the Indians
full and outside off, drives to a deepish mid-off. Shami's come out to bat with his fast-bowler's brain on. Knows it will be the near-yorker after a few bouncers

stops on the pitch and bounces a fair bit more than Umesh expects. Manages to blunt the good length ball down before it reaches the bowler on the full. Good instincts to use soft hands upon misbehaviour from the pitch
slices a very full, rather slow, delivery outside off to deep extra cover
with no one at mid-on, Umesh pummels a length ball with a fairly straight bat. Must have got lessons from Pujara before coming in

taken down leg? But umpire Nigel Llong says it must be off the thigh pad. Sri Lanka review. This is a shortish delivery, cramping the right-hander for room. Umesh is shuffling across, trying to protect his body, and fends at the ball. Replays suggest Llong's call is right, it has flicked the thigh pad. UltraEdge has no spike as ball passes bat. No five-for, Lakmal. Yet
another short ball, digging it into the middle of the pitch, and it responds to all that effort. The ball climbs on Umesh, who does very well to shift his weight back and pat it down by his feet
looks for the hook shot as Lakmal keeps banging it in. Umesh doesn't connect
full and outside off, drives to cover
smashes it to the long-off boundary - with a long-off in! Chandimal has only a couple of yards to move to his right, but he can't reach there. Shami is roaaaaaring.
it's the top-edge again, this time not entirely as well timed as the others in the previous Gamage over.

taken at deep midwicket and India are all out for 172. Gamage's plan of bouncing Shami works, but it's also yielded several bonus runs from the lower order. Big pull shot. Big top edge. Safely taken by Shanaka running in

big swing into the right-hander. But Samarawickrama, by virtue of his still head, and last-minute pulling back of his front leg, has the room to bring down a reasonably full face to hit it through midwicket

leans into a cover drive - Mahela, are you there? - and it very nearly travels to the boundary. Umesh, one of the best athletes in this team puts in a dive to drag a ball in front of him back within play
that's a great leave, trusting the bounce to take the good length delivery over off stump even if it had been threatening it. As it is, the ball is allowed to travel just past it

cuts back in off the seam and pins him on the back pad. Karunaratne is a touch tentative because this ball is pitched up. Comes down in a straight line - so gives the batsman no indication that it will cause mischief
full, inviting, drivable, but Karunaratne knows not to do so against the new ball with three slips in
on the pads, hits the pads, Karunaratne finds a single to the right of the wicketkeeper
around the wicket and into the thigh pad, Karunaratne clips it sweetly to the square leg boundary. A strength for the left-hander. A mighty strength
shuffles onto middle and off stump and turns a back of a length delivery towards vacant midwicket. Karunaratne seems to like the ball angled into him
gets forward and blocks a good length ball a shade outside off
flashes at a wide one and is lucky he doesn't nick off. Beautiful delivery, full, swinging away, then seamer further away off the pitch.
full and in line with the stumps, Samarawickrama drives stylishly to mid-on

ripper. He does bowl these on a regular basis because of an impeccable wrist position. The ball, invariably hits the deck with an upright seam, and on a grassy pitch, there is every opportunity for the ball to bite and dart wildly. This one pitches on middle and off and breaks away sharply, squaring Samarawickrama up
fuller delivery from around the wicket, Karunaratne defends into the covers
too straight and it's whipped away to the square leg boundary like an errant mosquito disturbing him whilst he was reading a really good book
punches a back of a length delivery to point - and even as he does so, he tries to check his shot because he feels the bat moving away from the body
outside edge as he lunges forward to block a good length ball holding its line outside off
giant front foot stride to defend a good length ball outside off
drives on the up - and the fact that he does so very easily suggests this pitch has eased out considerably. Rahane fell to such a ball, but here Samarawickrama plays the ball serenely to mid-off
fullish and on off stump, Karunaratne nudges it towards midwicket. Plays late, uses soft hands.

'yeah yeah' he yells and pinches a single - gets overthrows to his name for being proactive. Ashwin at midwicket collects the ball well enough but sends a wayward throw, which even hits Samarawickrama

pins him in front but Karunaratne has asked for a review. Peach of a ball from Shami, pitching on a good length and darting back in off the seam. Ultra-Edge confirms there is no bat but HawkEye shows the ball is bouncing over middle stump. Did hit the batsman near or even above the knee-roll and umpire Wilson has to change his decision.
good length ball on middle and off, turns it through mid-on for a single
good length ball outside off, blocks

gorgeous shot, and it demands that the fielder not stop it. Ashwin basically dives over the ball, and does so late as well. Good length, outside off, on the up drive, risky business, but it does look so good
shortish and outside off, Karunaratne taps it to point
waits and waits until the good length ball is right under his eyes and then he presents the straight bat. Excellent concentration
moves across as he tries to clip a shortish delivery off his pads, gets struck on the thigh
back of a length and outside off, Karunaratne ignores it

plays no shot and he's sent packing lbw. Karunaratne walks up to his partner and then goes for another review. Good length delivery, pitching outside off, so far that the batsman thinks he can safely leave it. The only problem is Bhuvi has bewitched it. The ball surges into the left-hander. strikes him on the knee-roll of his front foot and HawkEye says it will be hitting off stump
back of a length and outside off, defends through cover
goes for the bouncer, which Thirimanne ducks under and Saha does very well, moving to his right and timing his jump perfectly
cuts in shaaaarply off the seam again, and Thirimanne gets an inside edge to midwicket
another bouncer, no interest from the batsman. Kolkata roars as the hometown boy races in and then goes 'oooooh'
that's risky, playing the cover drive on the up against a fast bowler known to seam the ball both ways. Finds cover.
back of a length and outside off, blocks into the covers
waits and waits for the shortish delivery to come within his reach and then gives it a proper punch, all aimed at beating point to his left, but he won't let it through
goes for the bouncer, but with the line being outside off, Samarawickrama has an early warning to leave it
fishes at a good length ball outside off and it hurtles past the outside edge like they are mortal enemies

goes wide of the crease for a short ball, desperate to have it climb on the batsman. But Samarawickrama gets up on his toes and crunches it in front of point. He's got plenty of shots, drives that look like Jayawardene possesses his body

nicks off! That's the problem with his style of play on this type of wicket. The back foot punch to a shortish delivery that seams just enough to pass the middle and take the edge. Saha won't be fluffing those
teaser outside off, Mathews thinks about a defensive shot, and then realises, 'wait, that isn't threatening my stumps.' Good leave in the end

seems to start a touch wider of the crease and that slight change in angle makes Mathews - lead-footed as he is - push at a ball nipping away off the seam. Beats the batsman and ends a beautiful over beautifully
defends a good length ball outside off to cover
kicks up off a good length and Thirimanne is lucky not to have his face rearranged! Hits the deck, nips away off the seam, takes the glove and crashes into his left bicep
shuffles across to a back of a length delivery outside off and blocks

seeing Thirimanne always moving across at his crease, Shami goes for the pitched-up delivery and tries to make it seam into the left-hander. Lbw in play, and so would a bat-pad catcher if he had been in place. In the end, the inside edge goes to midwicket
back of a length and outside off, lets it go
shortish and outside off, from wide of the crease, Thirimanne lets it go
bouncer outside off, Mathews, who normally doesn't move his feet early in his innings, is made to camp back as he ducks. Look out for that teaser outside off again

there it is. The fuller delivery, swinging away, searching furiously for the outside edge, as furiously as a mother does when her kids have homework to do and are nowhere to be found. Mathews, lead-footed, is beaten
this one swings in, then seams in, then cramps Mathews, who is originally looking to leave the ball. Late decision to play. Good decision to use softer hands
back of a length and outside off, lets it go

huge appeal for lbw but umpire Llong says not out. Kohli goes for the review this time. What a ball from Bhuvi though. It angles into the right-hander, hits the deck and has plenty of second thoughts. Dangerous second thoughts. Mathews is squared up as this one holds its line, beats the closed face of his bat as he looks to hit midwicket. Impact on the back leg, reasonably high, higher than the knee roll of a bent back knee. Umpire Llong right again.
beats the outside edge. Bhuvi is making the ball do unreal things. From around the wicket, he pitches it on a good length in the corridor and then makes it nip away past the outside edge
goes back in his crease to ride the bounce of a short ball. Single past gully
back of a length and outside off, Thirimanne leaves so the ball targets Saha's face with a vengeance. Good job he has those big gloves
blocks a good length ball cutting into the left-hander to mid-on
lovely shot, through cover, all timing. This is the Pujara shot, waiting for the overpitched delivery and punching it so that he keeps perfect shape
lets go a shortish delivery outside off
plays late, pulls off the bottom hand and defuses all the threat in this back of a length delivery on off stump
walks out to Bhuvi, which is a decent tactic considering he's swinging it massively. Mathews defends
back of a length and outside off, lets it go
wide of the crease for a fullish delivery outside off, Mathews is nowhere near interested in that.
stays still in front of his stumps, for as long as possible, so is in perfect position to flick a big inswinger to deep square leg

some swing into the right-hander, Mathews is very tentative, but credit to him, plays close to the body, soft hands, and it runs off the inside edge nearly to the boundary. Rohit Sharma, the sub, puts in a big dive and saves two runs
fuller delivery just outside off, blocks it, though he doesn't care to move his feet much
starts with a short ball pitching outside leg and giving only Saha a proper workout.
on the pads again, Thirimanne clips it, in the air for a distance, to long leg
too wide to the right-hander too. Mathews is happy to leave those
there it is. Pitches it right up on off stump, gets it to shape away in the air, and Mathews, hanging back, playing late and with soft hands, blocks
reaches for the short ball outside off and blunts it down to backward point
fuller delivery outside off, Mathews doesn't care for it. Spurned like it's committed a fashion faux pas
fuller delivery outside off, defends nice and close to his body
head over the ball, soft hands meeting it, and that's why the fuller delivery skews out towards point
full and looking for the top of off stump, Mathews defends

pokes and misses outside off. This is what India are trying to do against Mathews. The ball that holds its line, a bit wide of off stump. A batsman who doesn't move his feet too much will often end up reaching for the ball well away from his body
walks at the bowler, who then changes his length, pitches it shorter, makes it seam away and Mathews is beaten yet again. Outstanding bowling
this time he keeps to his crease and blocks a good length ball on off stump
shortish on leg stump, Thirimanne gets right behind it
slides a short delivery down leg, Thirimanne flicks and misses
shortish on off stump, defends stolidly

past Saha's dive and away to the fine leg boundary. Targets the left-hander with a short ball, and Thirimanne doesn't look too comfortable. Shuffling across, he fends at it, gets a glove and just enough to beat a very good keeper. Fifty up for Sri Lanka
shortish and outside off, from around the wicket, Thirimanne nudges it to square leg
skiddy bowler gets the ball to keep a touch low on middle. Mathews hanging back works for him as he gets his bat down in time
shortish and on off stump, tucks it towards midwicket, which is vacant
gets forward and defends a fullish delivery a shade outside off
half-volley, or almost, from Bhuvi and Thirimanne laces it through cover. That gap has been set for the good length ball that decks away past the middle to the edge. This is too full though

back over the wicket and he delivers an absolute corker! Perfect seam, angled to the slips, pitches outside leg, and bounces away past the shoulder of the bat to Saha. As good as anything Warnie's pulled
another full delivery pitching on leg stump and moving away. Bhuvi is trying to square the batsman up, get the leading edge. He foils those plans with a full face
shortish and on leg stump, nudges to midwicket
good length outside off, slight bend in, but nothing menacing. Left alone
good length at off stump, solidly behind to defend into the leg side
back of a length, angled wide outside off. Goes after it with a slash with no intent to keep it down. Gets a thick outside edge that flies to the backward point boundary
this tails back sharply at middle stump, and he shuffles to show leg. Just gets bat to tickle it fine
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
bouncer at leg stump, too short for trouble. He ducks under it
short ball outside off, left alone with a duck
back of a length, swinging away from outside off. Left alone
good length at middle stump, stays on the crease and awkwardly fends this in front of mid-on with soft hands
good length outside off, leans into it and pokes wide of mid-off
squares him and finds the outside edge with a ripper in the corridor. Angled in at a length, nips away. But the edge bisects slip and gully
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length, swinging in at off stump. Looks to force this through the off side, but it ends up at mid-on as the swing catches the inside half of the bat
length and in at middle stump. Flicked to square leg

dropped. Dhawan puts down an easy one at first slip. Waist-height, to his right. The ball comes in at off stump and holds it's line slightly. Thirimanne playing inside the line offers a healthy edge and Dhawan covers the line, only to grass it
full outside off, leans in and stabs it through the covers
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
back of a length, angled into the pads. Flicked to fine leg's right
back of a length at off stump, plays away from the body, pokes it into the point region
full at middle stump, pushed to mid-on with no feet
back of a length, wide outside off and moving away. Lets it go
back of a length, shaping away from the corridor. Watches it late and defends off the outside half
thick outside edge as he drives on the up to a ball moving away. No feet once more and playing well in front of his body. It's short of point
lovely. Swings it away from a length, gets him to poke at it and beats the outside edge. Where are your feet, Angelo?!
good length, swinging in at off stump. Driven on the up to mid-off
good length, swung in at off stump. Defended aerially into the covers on the front foot
back of a length, in the corridor. Defended off the back foot
back of a length, wide outside off stump. Punched to point off the back foot
back of a length, swinging in at off stump. Defended to mid-on off the back foot
back of a length in the corridor, swings in and straightens as he pushes on the front foot. Runs past gully off the outside edge
short and wide, swinging away outside off. Left alone
back of a length and shaping away, follows it with his hands and pokes to point
good length outside off. Shapes for a big cover drive on the up but gets it off the toe-end as it swings away late
full and into the pads, no swing on this occasion. Clipped easily to the square leg boundary
good length outside off, hangs his bat out and gets the edge through the cordon, between second slip and gully
back of a length, angled in at off stump, and then cutting away sharply as he shapes to defend on the back foot. Shami is an unlucky man today. Bowled much better than the stats reflect
overpitched outside off, leans in to tap this to mid-off's left and steal a single
good length, shaping in at middle stump. He's in position to dab that through leg side but has to adjust as this straightens and squares him. Thick outside edge into the off side
good length, swinging away from outside off. Left alone
back of a length outside off, lots of width and not too much movement. The shot was on. Still not fully in control - slashed it aerially. But he gets it wide of point
back of a length, swinging away from off stump. Left alone
overpitched on leg stump. Closes the face too early as he tries to flick this through midwicket. Rolls back at the bowler
back of a length at leg stump, flicked to fine leg's right
back of a length in the corridor. Confused feet, but the body is behind line. Still manages only an inside edge as he tries to defend. Squeezes it into the leg side
back of a length, swinging away from the corridor. Defended with soft hands. Thick outside edge is stopped by a diving Rahane at third slip
back of a length in the corridor, defended to cover off the back foot
raps him in front of middle and off but that looked high and also sounded like there was an inside edge. Nipping in from outside off at a length, after taking the last few in the other direction
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
back of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length at middle, defended into the leg side off the back foot
pushed through, flat, middle stump and short. Flicked to deep midwicket off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended into the off side on the front foot
length at off stump, slides through. Defended solidly on the front foot
back of a length at leg stump, tickled to long leg's left off the back foot
back of a length, lifting off a length outside off. Watched carefully and defended late, square into the off side

lovely shot. Shuffles across and is perfectly positioned as this full ball arrives at middle stump. Holds his balance, offers the full face and then flicks the wrists at the last moment to get it wide of mid-on
bouncer, dug in too short at off stump. Ducks under it
back of a length at leg stump, climbing up at the thigh guard. Once more he shuffles early to set up and then whips it to the fine leg boundary
back of a length and climbing in the corridor, left alone

in the air but it falls short of midwicket. This comes in late off a length after starting at off stump. Thirmanne's front leg goes across more than forward and the head's falling into the off side. But he manages to survive after flicking
back of a length at off stump, comfortably on the back foot as he punches to long-on
back of a length, flat and in at off stump. Defended into the covers
good length, sliding in at off stump. Defended on the front foot

great shot. Ashwin is firing them in at 90+, and there's been no threat to the outside edge. He predicts the angle, gets down early and uses the length to get under this and lift it over square leg with a sweep
length at middle stump, defended into the leg side on the front foot
good length outside off, punched to extra cover with a big gap between bat and pad
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, gets on top of the pounce and pushes it through the covers on the up
good length, slight shape away from off stump. Gets inside the line and drops it to cover's left to steal a single
beats the inside edge comprehensively. Good length, nipping in from outside off. He's playing for the one that goes away as this scythes through and climbs over off stump
back of a length at middle stump, pushed into the leg side from the crease
good length, late swing in at off stump, but he has it covered because of his shuffle. Defended into the off side
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, shuffles and can't beat midwicket with the flick
length at middle stump, 94 kph. Tickled square into the leg side
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
full at middle stump, flicks to that straight midwicket fielder
full at leg stump, driven to long-on
back of a length in the corridor, defended towards the cordon with the outside half of the bat
good length at off stump, defended to mid-on from the crease
good length, late swing away from an off stump line. Mathews watches carefully as he defends
good length, in at off stump. Shuffles across and looks to nudge this to fine leg. Deflects off his pad through square leg
back of a length outside off, left alone
good length, swinging away from outside off. Left alone
good length at off stump, defended down the pitch
full at off stump, gets to the pitch and flicks it down to long-on
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
good length, sliding in at off stump. Defended on the front foot
back of a length at off stump, defended on the front foot
length at off stump, this one is faster. But he defends on the front foot without fuss
full and moving away from off stump. Driven back down the pitch. Bowler sticks out a right hand to grab it in his follow through
good length at off stump, closes the face to push this to square leg
back of a length at leg stump, flicked to fine leg
full and in at off stump, defended on the front foot
loose shot with not too much time to go for Tea. Nearly edges this. Back of a length from around the wicket, climbing up sharply as he looks to jab this through cover off the back foot. Beaten
and again. Good bowling this. Goes wide of the crease, angles it towards the batsman and gets it to straighten. Induces that jab away from the body again but can't find the edge
starts with a yorker, a shade outside off, Mathews jams the straight bat down on it. The batsman's reaction suggests he didn't really sight the ball properly
pitched up on off stump, defends with the bottom hand off
stays back to a shortish delivery and taps it to cover
beats him with a beauty. Perfect seam, hits the deck, darts away, has Mathews squared up and then waves bye-bye at the outside edge on the way through to the keeper
shortish on off stump, and that length makes it easier for Mathews to cover the line
reads the line of the ball to be wide outside off and so, after shuffling across in case it seams in, he ignores it
doesn't make the batsman play with his line being rather wide outside off
stands up tall against a back of a length delivery and punches it to cover
opens the face to glide a shortish delivery outside off behind point. That's his first run in 16 balls either side of the tea break
no feet, but his hand-eye coordination is spot on. The four through cover looks just as good though. Sweet timing, against a bit of a half-volley that is asking to be hit.
defends a slightly shortish delivery on middle with soft hands
firmly behind a back of a length ball outside off

shuffles across to protect his off stump and then makes a rather late decision to leave. A good decision too. He has no choice but to take that call as late as possible against a bowler from around the wicket

his first Test fifty since August 2015. It comes off a favourite shot - the cut over point. Standing ovation from the current captain in the dressing room, and a hug from his former captain out in the middle
brilliant pull, and he has read the length so early and the shot goes well in front of midwicket even. Lollipop short ball from Shami
shortish and outside off, pushes it to the left of mid-off

what happened there?. Everything looks hunky dory for as long as the ball takes to pass the batsman - a leave considering the line is outside off. But then as it goes through to the wicketkeeper, barely a foot in front, it wobbles away from Saha's gloves.
back of a length and just outside off, defends

back of a length and outside off, a squared up Mathews pats it to the right of cover. Even after two unofficial warnings, Mathews runs right down the pitch. And he's been given an official warning from Llong. One more of those and India get five free runs
back of a length and outside off, lets it go
fuller and outside off, Thirimanne, for once, reaches away from his body, looking to square drive on the up. Outside edge to third man

sweet timing on the flick, and if not for Shami's boot that would have been a four through square leg. A touch straight - which isn't bad, makes the batsman play on a tough pitch - but it's short though and that allows Mathews an easy put-away
shortish and sliding down leg. Thirimanne looks for the leg glance, but doesn't find it
bangs it in short - way short - and way outside off. Thirimanne is about as likely to play that as he is to break into song.
back of a length and outside off, no shot
absolute corker! He draws Mathews into a drive, the length a little fuller, the line close enough to off stump. The batsman throws his hands at it and a bit of seam movement away beats him
hangs back - is allowed to considering the length is short again - and Mathews blocks easily
allows the full delivery to come to him, and then, with soft hands, he flicks to mid-on, the wrists working overtime to keep the ball down

no third slip! The partnership has gone past 100 and Kohli as a result has gone defensive. Only two slips and a gully. Shami delivers a peach again. Back of a length. Off stump. Holds its line. Squares up Mathews. A genuine edge, which would have gone about chest high to third slip races away to the third man boundary
back of a length on off stump, defends
bouncer, loads of effort from Umesh, but it is all in vain as Thirimanne spots it early and ducks

taken low to the left of second slip and Kohli, after taking the catch, vents by chucking the ball at the turf. Beautiful bowling from Umesh, running in hard, digging the ball in short and getting it to straighten. The angle from around the wicket is to make sure the left-hander feels like he needs to play at these. Works a trick
back of a length on off stump, Chandimal defends
digs it in - but makes sure it is on middle - Chandimal is up on his toes to get on top of the ball and defuse it on the leg side

brutal pull, past the left of midwicket. Fifty for Mathews on his comeback. The set batsman can see Umesh is set on bowling short. And his game revolves around staying as deep in his crease as possible. He's not going to miss out on a back-foot swat
shortish on off stump, defends
pitches it right up on off stump, Chandimal needs to play and he does well. Soft hands, straight bat.
in line with fourth or fifth stump and Chandimal is forced to block again.
leaves alone a nip-backer, which thuds into Chandimal's thigh. Too high to think about an lbw appeal
goes wide of the crease to put the batsman in trouble against a ball that holds its line outside off. Chandimal, badly squared up, is still able to defend it
fuller delivery outside off, steps forward to drive sweetly to cover

<s>great leave</s>? a great ball actually! Eden roars as Shami pitches a good length ball in the off stump corridor. It kicks up like the pitch is suddenly a trampoline and Chandimal shapes to play it, is playing it and the pull back comes after the ball passes the edge
good length and outside off, Mathews enjoys the sighter
shortish and outside off, Mathews blunts it
full and outside off, drives to mid-off
teaser, very wide outside off, Mathews does go after it, with his feet firmly back, and on leg stump. Goes off the inside edge back down to the bowler

very very tame! Mathews walks off after giving catching practice to short cover. He throws his head back and yells 'Noooo'. He knows as the team's most experienced batsman he can't be making such silly mistakes. A drive on the up to a good length ball with Rahul, the close(ish)-in fielder, staring him in the face. That's a rookie mistake
shortish and outside off from around the wicket. Dickwella sticks his bat up in the air
very full and outside off, blocks
beaten. This is a 40-over ball. And Shami is making it hoop around like its been black magicked. Full. A shade outside off. Luring the batsman into an airy drive. Too good
now the in-dipper, looking for middle and off stump. Chandimal has to play close to his body, has to give it respect
probes away in the off stump corridor, Chandimal, shuffling across, lets it go
and the bouncer, just to show Chandimal he can do that too. The batsman does well to leave it

cuts him in half! Shami is on faaaiiiiaaah. Pitches it only a shade outside off, but its an in-between length. Chandimal doesn't know what he should do. He eventually comes forward, but by then it is too late. The ball has zipped between his inside edge and gone through to the wicketkeeper

happy hooker has to go! But he doesn't want to. He's reviewing and Dickwella will get to stay. That's only because he's been beaten for pace and the ball pings off his right shoulder and settles in Saha's gloves.
shortish and outside off, punches it through point

that's a poor shot. India are bowling beauties every over. As an opposition captain, you can't be giving them such chances. Big booming cover drive on the up - the kind you can get away with on a flat pitch. But here, you cannot indulge.
back of a length and outside off, leaves it alone, as he should

goes wide of the crease for a back of a length ball on off stump. Chandimal nudges it towards square leg. Pujara does well to move to his right but he can't hit the target, which is basically only one stump
shortish delivery on middle and leg. Dickwella shuffles across, attempts a flick, but wears it on the thigh pad
back of a length and outside off, Dickwella squirts an inside edge behind square leg
walks at the bowler - this seems to be a plan against Bhuvneshwar, who upsets it by pulling his length back and getting the ball to dart past the outside edge. Seam movement still on offer
drawn into playing away from his body again - and it's only a defensive shot. The best he will get off that is a single. The worst, which is far more likely - a nick to the cordon
back of a length and outside off, Chandimal, having moved across, leaves

maaaaaassive inswing. Starts way outside off but then as if its been attracted by a ball-magnet placed at the base of off stump, it surges into the right-hander. Chandimal pulls his front leg back so he can present a straight bat to it. #(Bhu)vicious
fuller delivery outside off, pushes through cover
full and outside off, defends. Umesh into his seventh over
on the pads and Chandimal isn't able to get it away - finds Pujara in front of square leg. That's a good man to have, helping India bowl straight
works it off his pads to long leg
shortish and outside off, pats it to cover
gets outside the line of a short ball on middle and the leg glance fetches a boundary. Sri Lanka nearing 150.

are India getting the ball to reverse? There is massive swing into the left-hander, so much that a ball ripe to be cover driven skews off the inside edge to deep square leg. Dickwella does all he needs to as well, wait for the ball and only punch it so that he isn't playing a shot away from his body. Yet...
too short, which allows Chandimal the opportunity to ride the bounce and glide the ball to point
he manages to time a ball he isn't really keen on playing. Single past the right of point

he comes down the track again, thinking that's the only way to negate Bhuvi's swing. Instead, he's beaten again. That's because Bhuvi spots that early movement, shortens his length, and the pitch does the rest
goes wide of the crease for a full delivery on off stump, Chandimal blocks
good length, outside off, no shot

nip off the deck, and it happens so late, and the ball zips by so quickly, that Chandimal is made to look like a tailender. Back of a length, a shade outside off, and because of that he isn't clear whether he needs to play it or not. At the very last second, when it hurtles in at him, he is forced into a shot and is beaten on the inside edge
back of a length outside off, left alone
good length, angled in at the corridor. Leans in and punches to extra cover
back of a length outside off, gets behind the line and chops it to deep point's left
beauty. Full inswinger outside off. Leans into this nicely and gets the weight through his hands as he creams the drive wide of mid-off
nearly chips one to midwicket. Back of a length delivery sits in the pitch a tad as he looks to whip this. On the bounce to midwicket
full toss, drifts away from outside off. Taps it into the covers wathcfully
back of a length, angled in at off stump. Chandimal stays put this time and watches it onto the pad as he swivels to flick past square leg

full outside off. Stays put once more and leans in beautifully...then overcompensates by setting off for a single when the ball is rolling straight to Jadeja at mid-off. Has to dive in the end. And he's safe because Jadeja misses...and it goes through midwicket for four overthrows. Holding his hip as he gets back up. Risky run and, honestly, indicative of Chandimal's innings so far. Very anxious
beauty. Good length, swinging away from the corridor. No feet, only hands. No connection either
length at off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length, shaping away from the corridor. Leaves it alone without covering off stump
brings it back in from outside off now. Dickwella reacts quickly to punch it into the covers
swings it away, but it starts way outside off. Chandimal stays in his crease and lets it pass
nicely bowled. 138 kph, good length and hooping away from the corridor. No stride from Chandimal. Defends slightly away from the body
back of a length outside off, swinging away, but once again too wide to play. Left alone
brings it back in from a length at off stump. Chandimal shovels it wide of mid-on from under his eyes
short ball from around the wicket. No room for the hook. But he goes for it anyway and drags it off the top edge to fine leg's right
back of a length on the pads, nudged to fine leg
back of a length, swinging away from outside off. Shuffles to cover his stumps and lets it go
good length, swinging away outside off. Chandimal's front leg is still moving as he chases this with his hands. Beaten on the outside edge

there he goes again. Chandimal walked at the ball a lot last evening. First instance now. Wants to cover for the swing, but he's not to the pitch. It swings away from the corridor and beats the outside edge
length outside off, swinging away from outside off. Left alone
back of a length outside off, an emphatic leave
full and swinging away a touch from off stump. Pushed to mid-off with soft hands
back of a length outside off, 139kph, zips through as he lets it go. Saha surprised. collects it in front of his face
the trademark pick up and the scores are level. Length ball fired into his pads. He stands tall with the front leg into the off side and chips it to the square leg boundary

length and wide outside off. Looks for a big square drive away from his body and is beaten. There was a sound, which made Kohli appeal. Not out said the umpire. No one else was interested. Shami shakes his head
length outside off, defended into the off side
back of a length, lifting across the off stump. A half-hearted attempt to ramp it over slip. Nowhere near that, the batsman
short ball, angled away from off stump. This time time he gets on top of the bounce and bunts it to deep square
full at off stump, pushed past the bowler to mid-off, from the crease
back of a length outside off, and hardly any movement. Allows Dickwella to follow the ball with his hands and stab this to deep point's left
back of a length outside off. Once more he leans into it with minimal feet and punches it past cover

good length, shaping away from the corridor. Looks like reverse swing. Dickwella pushes in front of his body and gets a thick outside edge that runs past gully and to deep point's right this time. Umesh Yadav there, sprints and gets down just in time
length and moving across off stump, defended into the off side
length at off stump. It's coming off a touch slow after pitching. Dickwella stays in the crease and pokes it back at the bowler
good length in the corridor, solidly behind it to defend on the front foot
back of a length, coming in at off stump. Nips away and sits in the pitch a bit as he closes the face early on this. Lobs back at the bowler, but no danger
sweeeeeet. Full ball, swinging away from off stump. He stands his ground and uses soft hands to flick it past mid-on. All balance
back of a length outside off, watchfully let go
short and wide outside off, left alone
back of a length, swinging away from off stump. Left alone

what a shot! This is full and swinging away from off stump. Once more, there's no zip off the pitch. Is it starting to slow? Doesn't matter to this guy. Gets his hands under this and defies everything to scoop it over mid-on
back of a length at middle stump, closes the face to push this towards mid-on with soft hands
oh glorious. Some classy shots in the last six balls. This is full and swinging away outside off. He leans into it and caresses it past mid-off
back of a length, nipping back in from the corridor this time. Chandimal doesn't pick that. Feeble push away from the body but, to his credit, with soft hands. Thick edge rolls past gully
good length in the corridor. Angles in and holds it's shape. Chandimal squared up. Forces it into the covers
good length outside off, big stride to defend into the covers
full outside off, no feet. Tapped back down the pitch
good length outside off. Pushes at it outside off. Beaten on the outside edge. That straightened after coming in
shot. Short and wide from Shami, with no movement. He shuffles to reach at this and spanks it off the middle to the point boundary
well bowled. Back of a length in the corridor, nips back in and climbs sharply as he feels for it. He plays inside the line and is beaten

straight to second slip. The bounce again, from Shami. The ball swings inside, lands on the seam in the corridor and lifts off to take the outside edge as he pokes inside the line of this. Flies through quick at Kohli who is nicely balanced and snags this with the reverse cup
full and wobbling in the corridor. No feet as he looks to drive. Trickles to point off the outer half of the bat
back of a length, moving away outside off. Poked through the covers, to deep point's right
back of a length outside off, left alone

doesn't pick the inswinger and shoulders arms to one that hits him on the back flap in front of middle stump. Given out by the umpire. He reviews straight away...it won't work. He's out. He's leaping up as he's about to leave this, but it's clipping the middle stump according to the tracker. Umpire's call. Sri Lanka won't lose the review, but they lose the wicket. Bhuvneshwar took the last ball away from the same spot. Masterful
it is an inswinger. Length and hooping in from outside off. But Perera puts in a big stride to defend outside off. He's struck on the pad and maybe that's hitting off, but he's outside the line
length outside off, left alone
another inswinger. This starts full at middle and slams into the pad as he looks to flick
climbs past the outside edge. Shami is getting some serious jump from a length. This one is outside off and draws Chamdinal forward, only to send him back as it climbs

has he edged it? Yes he has! There were four, maybe five, overs of superb batting from Sri Lanka. Now, it's the bowlers' turn. Stunning period of bowling. Caused all sorts of trouble to Chandimal, Shami, and then he floats up an outswinger in the corridor. Not a confident shot this time from the visting captain. Half stride and then a jab away from the body. A thin edge, taken easily behind the stumps
zips over off stump. Herath's feet are stuck. Back of a length ball, angling away, then cutting back in to beat him
the bouncer now. No feet from Herath again as he looks to hook this. Nowhere near getting bat on it

oh wow, Shami is on fire right now. All the speculation of the pitch possibly slowing down is looking silly now. This one darts back from a length and is headed for off stump. Herath is puzzled and brings the bat down. The ball hits it too, but I don't think he knew much about that
full at middle stump. Looks to flick, gets a leading edge that rolls past mid-off
good length, angles in at off stump, then it swings away. Past the outside edge
oh good shot. Bhuvneshwar swings it in from a similar spot. Length and at off stump. Herath picks the angle and shovels aerially through midwicket, on the up
good length, swinging away from off stump and shooting upwards off the pitch again. Beats the outside edge

ah. All sorts of contorted, is Rangaiyya. This is an outswinger, in the corridor at a length. He swivels - in the stiff manner only he can - and flicks his wrists fast with the bat almost turning in fine leg's direction. The ball, about three yards in the other direction as this happens
length at the pads, clipped to deep square leg
back of a length, swinging in from wide outside off. He crouches to try and slash through point but this shoots through from under the bat
overpitched ball wide outside off. Herath wafts at it, beaten on the outside edge
short ball at off stump. Hangs back to try and pull, but it skids into the top part of his bat and lobs in midwicket's direction
good length at off stump, calmly behind this. Pokes it out to deep backward point
back of a length just outside off. Pokes away from the body for the outswinger and gets beaten on the inside edge
good length, in the corridor. Covers the off stump and lets it go

nips it back in and catches him in front of off stump. This looks plumb. It's given. He won't even review at first. Starts to walk before turning around and reviewing. It's an indipper that strikes him in front of off stump on the back pad...and the change of mind saves him! This has hit him just outside off stump. He survives. Nigel Llong the umpire.
full and shaping away from off stump. Stabs at it with no feet and hard hands. Thick inside edge down to fine leg
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
